active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group of 4, debate the trade-offs of 'shifting security left' in CSI: Does it slow down development velocity or prevent costly breaches? Use real-world examples from NIST SP 800-204D or OWASP Top 10 CI/CD (e.g., insufficient credential hygiene) to support arguments, and vote on a consensus recommendation.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education. Generate a deck of 50 high-quality flashcards on 'Continuous Security Integration' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 008_Application Security > Web 008_Application Security > 002_Secure Coding and Architecture > Secure Development Lifecycle > Continuous Security Integration). Base content on provided research: Core concepts (DevSecOps, CI/CD, SSC, artifacts, maturity); Frameworks (NIST SP 800-204D: SSC in pipelines; CIS Controls; OWASP SPVS tiers; OWASP Top 10 CI/CD: risks like credential issues, untrusted code, tampered artifactsâ€”mitigate with scanning/signing); Tools (SonarQube SAST, Dependabot SCA, Cosign); Voter priorities (82.9% consensus). Incorporate pedagogy: - Learning Objectives: [Paste the 6 objectives here]. - Scaffolding: Balance cards across 4 layers [Paste scaffolding descriptions]. - Active Learning: Tie explanations to discussion/peer teaching/problem-solving [Paste active learning]. - Prior Knowledge: Assume CI/CD basics; anchor to DevSecOps. Use Flashcard Schema exactly: - Front: MCQ (4 options) or short-answer. - Back: **Correct Answer**, Explanation (pedagogical link), Bloom Level, Layer, References. - Distractors: 3 plausible per MCQ per protocol [Paste distractor rules]. Output as markdown deck: # Continuous Security Integration Flashcards ## Metadata - Objectives: [List] - Sources: NIST SP 800-204D (csrc.nist.gov), CIS Controls, OWASP SPVS, OWASP Top 10 CI/CD. --- **Card 1** **Front:** ... **Back:** ... Ensure cards progress Bloom's (REMEMBER to CREATE), are SMART-assessable, and promote active recall. No fluff; precise, educational.
